name: San Martin Hotel & Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't get any closer to the park on the Brazil side of the falls. You could stay at Cataratas which is inside the park, but it also costs at least 5 times the rate of San Martin.
reviews.title: Close to the national park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an easy 5 minute walk from the front door to the ticket booth.
reviews.title: Decent hotel with LOTS of extras... a bit on the large side though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The foyer and reception areas of the building have 70's style granite floors and heavy wooden beams so it is very dark during the day. Nothing really wrong, although I was a little disappointed no to see flares and colourful polyester body shirts! The corridors are a little noisy but nothing too intrusive.
reviews.title: Expensive, not worth the money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a reasonable size and have basic fittings. Everything is clean and functional. The staff are friendly and speak a little English, but brush up on your Portuguese if you expect to be understood.
reviews.title: Dark, gloomy & cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great. Didn't eat a large main meal at the restaurant so can't comment, but the service was friendly and fast.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at the San Martin Hotel in Foz do Iguacu for two nights in early June. I had a meeting in Curitiba and wanted to visit the waterfalls so made a quick trip to Foz and loved it! I was solo so I really appreciated having someone pick me up at the airport and was able to check into the hotel early. There were very few people staying there so I was able to sit out by the pool relatively undisturbed. The room (I think it was a superior) was very clean and relatively newly remodeled. Hot water in the showers. Breakfast was OK, nothing great, but it was free so I wasn't complaining. I ate dinner in the bar and had a drink which was also nice.
reviews.title: Great Place, Fabulous Location, Good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walking distance to the Brazil side of the falls so I was able to be one of the very first people in the park and beat the crowds. I arranged a trip to the Argentina side of the falls through the concierge. The drive cost about $75 round trip but it was worth it as the driver dealt with the border crossing for me and dropped me off right in front of the park gates and was there to pick me up right on time.
reviews.title: Conveniently located for a trip to Iguacu Falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only negative about the hotel was that the rooms were very neat and clean but there were many very small ants in the room that managed to get everywhere including my laptop. Not a big deal, but they would have recieved 5 starts otherwise.
reviews.title: Great location and grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the San Martin Hotel for three nights in late February. Our main reason for going to Iguacu was to see the falls (no surprise there then!), so found the location perfect as it was a very easy walking distance away.
reviews.title: Great Location & Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was fine - the grounds were lovely, the air-conditioned reception area offered welcome respite for use newly arrived Brits who weren't used to the heat. Our room was a bit tired but was always well cleaned. It had a gym which we used a couple of times - didn't go in the pool as by the time we got through with the Falls we had had enough of water!
reviews.title: average and very touristic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I knew that San Martin was not top notch but I must say I was very disappointed. On arrival I was very impressed, the public areas spacious and well presented. The room was basic, a tiny bed for two people, anyone 'oversized' would not have fitted, but seemed to be clean. Unfortunately no plugs for wash basin or bath. When asked the reception said that they had been stolen by guests! they eventually came up with one that was too small but they wrapped it with sellotape and it worked partially.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was poor, first night we opted for buffet, second night a la carte, which was slightly better. Breakfasts not very good.
reviews.title: Great position and reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and grounds are lovely.
reviews.title: If you need to stay close to the falls, I think this is the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The worst thing was the cockroaches in the bathroom, they scuttled out when I turned the light on, ugh!! The staff said that it was as a result of being in the forest and gave us an aerosol can to deal with the problem.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else - terrible hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It is , however, very close to the falls and the bird park.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel close to the Falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel for just 1 night. The room we've had was good. The buffet diner was also good, the pool was good also..... but then we wanted to confirm our flight by the internet, then they charged us for 15 min. 3,50 Real. And to print out for ex. a Boarding Pass, that was not possible cause they didn't have a printer. We travelled for 3 weeks through Argentina, and even in the most cheapest Hotel/hostel, you could internet for free and als print something. Very strange.... Then the staff (also the lady from the travel agency). They need to get a course how to get around with people (customers). What a grumpy staff. I never write a review, but this is the one who get's it.
reviews.title: What is in the name "Service"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can find another hotel, go there!!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent visit to San Martin- definitely recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had an excellent visit to San Martin in Oct 2010. Stayed 3 nights which was perfect to see falls in both Brazil and Argentina. We stayed in a recently renovated Superior Class room which was very nice- hard wood floors, new comfortable queen bed, good air conditioning, in room safe, modern tastefully done bathroom, good view of pool, free wifi in room and lobby. Beautiful grounds with tropical flowers. Nice exercise room with both weights and cardio. Very tasteful lobby area. Thought the breakfast buffet was excellent with much fresh fruit, breads, etc.- more European style breakfast than American. We really liked the dinner buffets- wide range of interesting salads, many main dishes, and lovely desserts, all changing every night, at a price well below what would cost in US. The tourist desk helped arrange private transportation to falls in Argentina and driver knew how to bypass long lines at passport control and long bank lines for exchanging currency. And of course, a 5 minute walk to falls in Brazil from San Martin. Have traveled very widely to many countries and many nice hotels. This was a very positive experience; I'd clearly book it again if we return and would suggest to friends. No complaints. Not sure what less complementary reviews are about- I have high standards and was quite pleased here.
reviews.title: Lots of Good & Lots of Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay here, DO NOT book a standard room, I shutter to think of what the economy rooms would have been like. We booked a standard, and it was so awful, we got upgraded to a superior room, but it would have been worth the extra money if I'd had to do it. What the others say about gloomy, smelly & dingy is all true, and they have no english TV in the standard rooms. On the other hand, the superior rooms have english TV, and the rooms are much brighter and we did not notice any smells. All else is the same, but this makes all the difference.
reviews.title: Not great service and very poor buffet dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The front office staff may have been prejudiced about us since we complained so much about the rooms, but they were terrible. It's unfortunate too, because everyone else in the hotel, restaurant, bar, etc were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location for the falls but not an amazing hotel

description: San Martin Hotel and Resort is located just for 400 meters from the main entrance of the National Park, 03 kilometers from Foz do Iguaçu Airport, and 10 kilometers from the downtown. The resort has 135 rooms, divided in 3 categories. The simple one is the standard, the superior is a medium comfort, and superior class the deluxe one, and junior suites. All the rooms have TV, air con, minibar, telephone, wi-fi free of charge, trail inside of the wood for walking, and a beautiful and wonderful pool.
